meanings.definition: The quality of being very precise and demanding in requirements or standards.
meanings.sent1: Her exactingnesses in grading papers made her students strive for perfection.
meanings.sent2: The exactingnesses of the chef ensured that every dish was flawless.
meanings.sent3: The exactingnesses of the fashion designer led to a runway show filled with impeccable designs.
meanings.sent4: His exactingnesses in choosing the right words for his novel made it a literary masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The exactingnesses of the architect resulted in a breathtakingly beautiful building.

meanings.definition: The act of requiring great precision or attention to detail.
meanings.sent1: The exactingnesses of the job left no room for errors.
meanings.sent2: She approached her work with the exactingnesses of a skilled craftsman.
meanings.sent3: The exactingnesses of the puzzle made it both challenging and rewarding to solve.
meanings.sent4: The exactingnesses of the surgeon's movements were crucial during the delicate operation.
meanings.sent5: His exactingnesses in following the recipe resulted in a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: The state of being extremely strict or rigorous in expectations.
meanings.sent1: The exactingnesses of the coach pushed the team to achieve their best performance.
meanings.sent2: His exactingnesses in training his employees led to a highly efficient team.
meanings.sent3: The exactingnesses of the judge were known throughout the courtroom.
meanings.sent4: The exactingnesses of the conductor brought out the best in the orchestra.
meanings.sent5: Her exactingnesses in maintaining order made her classroom a disciplined environment.
